158static std::string extract_filename(const fs::path &source)
159{
160 return source.filename().string();
161}
162
163// cmdfiles(argc,argv) process the command-line arguments
164// it also processes the 'sstools.ini' file and any
165// indirect files ('id @myfile')
166
167static void process_sstools_ini()
168{
169 const std::string sstools_ini{locate_input_file("sstools.ini")}; // look for SSTOOLS.INI
170 if (sstools_ini.empty())
171 {
172 return;
173 }
174
175 if (std::FILE *init_file = std::fopen(sstools_ini.c_str(), "r"); init_file != nullptr)
176 {
177 command_file(init_file, CmdFile::SSTOOLS_INI); // process it
178 }
179}
180
181static void process_simple_command(char *cur_arg)
182{
183 bool processed{};
184 if (std::strchr(cur_arg, '=') == nullptr)
185 {
186 // not xxx=yyy, so check for gif
187 std::string filename = cur_arg;
188 if (!has_ext(filename))
189 {
190 filename += ".gif";
191 }
192 filename = find_file(ReadFile::IMAGE, filename).string();
193 if (!filename.empty())
194 {
195 if (std::FILE *init_file = std::fopen(filename.c_str(), "rb"))
196 {
197 char signature[6];
198 if (std::fread(signature, 1, 6, init_file) != 6)
199 {
200 throw std::system_error(
201 errno, std::system_category(), "process_simple_command failed fread");
202 }
203 if (signature[0] == 'G' && signature[1] == 'I' && signature[2] == 'F' &&
204 signature[3] >= '8' && signature[3] <= '9' && signature[4] >= '0' && signature[4] <= '9')
205 {
206 g_read_filename = find_file(ReadFile::IMAGE, cur_arg);
207 if (!g_read_filename.empty())
208 {
209 g_browse.name = extract_filename(g_read_filename);
210 g_show_file = ShowFile::LOAD_IMAGE;
211 }
212 processed = true;
213 }
214 std::fclose(init_file);
215 }
216 }
217 }
218 if (!processed)
219 {
220 cmd_arg(cur_arg, CmdFile::AT_CMD_LINE); // process simple command
221 }
222}
223
224static bool process_file_set_name(const std::string &filename, const std::string &param_name)
225{
226 const std::filesystem::path saved_path{g_parameter_file};
227 const std::string saved_name{g_parameter_set_name};
228 g_parameter_file = filename;
229 g_parameter_set_name = param_name;
230 std::FILE *init_file = nullptr;
231 if (find_file_item(g_parameter_file, g_parameter_set_name, &init_file, ItemType::PAR_SET) ||
232 init_file == nullptr)
233 {
234 g_parameter_file = saved_path;
235 g_parameter_set_name = saved_name;
236 return false;
237 }
238 command_file(init_file, CmdFile::AT_CMD_LINE_SET_NAME);
239 return true;
240}
241
242static void process_file(char *cur_arg)
243{
244 fs::path path{&cur_arg[1]};
245 if (!path.has_extension())
246 {
247 path.replace_extension(".par");
248 }
249 path = find_file(ReadFile::PARAMETER, path.string());
250 if (path.empty())
251 {
252 arg_error(cur_arg);
253 return;
254 }
255
256 std::FILE *init_file = std::fopen(path.string().c_str(), "r");
257 if (init_file == nullptr)
258 {
259 arg_error(cur_arg);
260 return;
261 }
262
263 command_file(init_file, CmdFile::AT_CMD_LINE_SET_NAME);
264}
265
266void cmd_files(const int argc, const char *const *argv)
267{
268 if (g_first_init)
269 {
270 init_vars_run(); // once per run initialization
271 }
272 init_vars_restart(); // <ins> key initialization
273 init_vars_fractal(); // image initialization
274
275 process_sstools_ini();
276
277 // cycle through args
278 for (int i = 1; i < argc; i++)
279 {
280 char cur_arg[141];
281 std::strcpy(cur_arg, argv[i]);
282 if (cur_arg[0] == ';') // start of comments?
283 {
284 break;
285 }
286 if (cur_arg[0] != '@')
287 {
288 process_simple_command(cur_arg);
289 }
290 // @filename/setname?
291 else if (char *slash = std::strchr(cur_arg, '/'); slash != nullptr)
292 {
293 if (!process_file_set_name(std::string{cur_arg + 1, slash}, slash + 1))
294 {
295 arg_error(cur_arg);
296 }
297 }
298 // @filename
299 else
300 {
301 process_file(cur_arg);
302 }
303 }
304
305 if (!g_first_init)
306 {
307 g_init_mode = -1; // don't set video when <ins> key used
308 g_show_file = ShowFile::IMAGE_LOADED; // nor startup image file
309 }
310
311 init_msg("", nullptr, CmdFile::AT_CMD_LINE); // this causes driver_get_key if init_msg called on runup
312
313 if (g_debug_flag != DebugFlags::ALLOW_INIT_COMMANDS_ANYTIME)
314 {
315 g_first_init = false;
316 }
317
318 // PAR reads a file and sets color, don't read colors from GIF
319 g_read_color = !g_colors_preloaded || g_show_file != ShowFile::LOAD_IMAGE;
320}
321
322static void init_param_flags()
323{
324 s_init_corners = false;
325 s_init_params = false;
326 s_init_functions = false;
327}
328
329// when called, file is open in binary mode, positioned at the
330// '(' or '{' following the desired parameter set's name
331CmdArgFlags load_commands(std::FILE *infile)
332{
333 init_param_flags(); // reset flags for type=
334 const CmdArgFlags ret = command_file(infile, CmdFile::AT_AFTER_STARTUP);
335
336 // PAR reads a file and sets color, don't read colors from GIF
337 g_read_color = !g_colors_preloaded || g_show_file != ShowFile::LOAD_IMAGE;
338
339 return ret;
340}
341
342static void init_vars_run() // once per run init
343{
344 s_init_random_seed = static_cast<int>(std::time(nullptr));
345 init_comments();
346 const char *p = getenv("TMP");
347 if (p == nullptr)
348 {
349 p = getenv("TEMP");
350 }
351 if (p != nullptr)
352 {
353 if (is_a_directory(p))
354 {
355 g_temp_dir = p;
356 }
357 }
358 else
359 {
360 g_temp_dir.clear();
361 }
362}

364static void init_libraries()
365{
366 clear_read_library_path();
367 clear_save_library();
368 const fs::path docs_dir{g_special_dirs->documents_dir() / ID_PROGRAM_NAME};
369 add_read_library(docs_dir);
370 set_save_library(docs_dir);
371}

550
551// mode = AT_CMD_LINE command line @filename
552// SSTOOLS_INI sstools.ini
553// AT_AFTER_STARTUP <@> command after startup
554// AT_CMD_LINE_SET_NAME command line @filename/setname
555// note that cmdfile could be open as text OR as binary.
556// binary is used in @ command processing for reasonable speed note/point
557static CmdArgFlags command_file(std::FILE *handle, const CmdFile mode)
558{
559 if (mode == CmdFile::AT_AFTER_STARTUP || mode == CmdFile::AT_CMD_LINE_SET_NAME)
560 {
561 int i;
562 while ((i = std::getc(handle)) != '{' && i != EOF)
563 {
564 }
565 clear_command_comments();
566 }
567
568 char cmd_buf[10000]{};
569 char line_buf[513];
570 line_buf[0] = 0;
571 int line_offset{};
572 CmdArgFlags change_flag{}; // &1 fractal stuff chgd, &2 3d stuff chgd
573 while (next_command(cmd_buf, std::size(cmd_buf), handle, line_buf, &line_offset, mode) > 0)
574 {
575 if ((mode == CmdFile::AT_AFTER_STARTUP || mode == CmdFile::AT_CMD_LINE_SET_NAME) && std::strcmp(cmd_buf, "}") == 0)
576 {
577 break;
578 }
579 const CmdArgFlags i = cmd_arg(cmd_buf, mode);
580 if (i == CmdArgFlags::BAD_ARG)
581 {
582 break;
583 }
584 change_flag |= i;
585 }
586 std::fclose(handle);
587
588 if (bit_set(change_flag, CmdArgFlags::FRACTAL_PARAM))
589 {
590 backwards_legacy_v18();
591 backwards_legacy_v19();
592 backwards_legacy_v20();
593 }
594 return change_flag;
595}
596
597static int next_command(
598 char *cmd_buf, const int max_len, std::FILE *handle, char *line_buf, int *line_offset, const CmdFile mode)
599{
600 int cmd_len{};
601 char *line_ptr = line_buf + *line_offset;
602 while (true)
603 {
604 while (*line_ptr <= ' ' || *line_ptr == ';')
605 {
606 if (cmd_len) // space or ; marks end of command
607 {
608 cmd_buf[cmd_len] = 0;
609 *line_offset = static_cast<int>(line_ptr - line_buf);
610 return cmd_len;
611 }
612 while (*line_ptr && *line_ptr <= ' ')
613 {
614 ++line_ptr; // skip spaces and tabs
615 }
616 if (*line_ptr == ';' || *line_ptr == 0)
617 {
618 if (*line_ptr == ';'
619 && (mode == CmdFile::AT_AFTER_STARTUP || mode == CmdFile::AT_CMD_LINE_SET_NAME)
620 && (g_command_comment[0].empty() || g_command_comment[1].empty()
621 || g_command_comment[2].empty() || g_command_comment[3].empty()))
622 {
623 // save comment
624 ++line_ptr;
625 while (*line_ptr && (*line_ptr == ' ' || *line_ptr == '\t'))
626 {
627 ++line_ptr;
628 }
629 if (*line_ptr)
630 {
631 if (static_cast<int>(std::strlen(line_ptr)) >= MAX_COMMENT_LEN)
632 {
633 *(line_ptr+MAX_COMMENT_LEN-1) = 0;
634 }
635 for (std::string &elem : g_command_comment)
636 {
637 if (elem.empty())
638 {
639 elem = line_ptr;
640 break;
641 }
642 }
643 }
644 }
645 if (next_line(handle, line_buf, mode))
646 {
647 return -1; // eof
648 }
649 line_ptr = line_buf; // start new line
650 }
651 }
652 if (*line_ptr == '\\' && *(line_ptr+1) == 0) // continuation onto next line?
653 {
654 if (next_line(handle, line_buf, mode))
655 {
656 arg_error(cmd_buf); // missing continuation
657 return -1;
658 }
659 line_ptr = line_buf;
660 while (*line_ptr && *line_ptr <= ' ')
661 {
662 ++line_ptr; // skip white space @ start next line
663 }
664 continue; // loop to check end of line again
665 }
666 cmd_buf[cmd_len] = *line_ptr++; // copy character to command buffer
667 if (++cmd_len >= max_len) // command too long?
668 {
669 arg_error(cmd_buf);
670 return -1;
671 }
672 }
673}
674
675static bool next_line(std::FILE *handle, char *line_buf, const CmdFile mode)
676{
677 bool tools_section = true;
678 while (file_gets(line_buf, 512, handle) >= 0)
679 {
680 if (mode == CmdFile::SSTOOLS_INI && line_buf[0] == '[') // check for [id]
681 {
682 char tmp_buf[11];
683 std::strncpy(tmp_buf, &line_buf[1], 4);
684 tmp_buf[4] = 0;
685 string_lower(tmp_buf);
686 tools_section = std::strncmp(tmp_buf, "id]", 3) == 0;
687 continue; // skip tools section heading
688 }
689 if (tools_section)
690 {
691 return false;
692 }
693 }
694 return true;
695}

699 NON_NUMERIC = -32767

740
741struct Command
742{
743 Command(char *cur_arg, CmdFile a_mode);
744 CmdArgFlags bad_arg() const;
745 void init_msg() const;
746
747 char *arg;
748 CmdFile mode{};
749 char *value{};
750 std::string variable;
751 int value_len{}; // length of value
752 int num_val{}; // numeric value of arg
753 char char_val[16]{}; // first character of arg
754 int yes_no_val[16]{}; // 0 if 'n', 1 if 'y', -1 if not
755 int total_params{}; // # of / delimited parms
756 int num_int_params{}; // # of / delimited ints
757 int num_float_params{}; // # of / delimited floats
758 int int_vals[64]{}; // pre-parsed integer parms
759 double float_vals[16]{}; // pre-parsed floating parms
760 const char *float_val_strs[16]{}; // pointers to float vals
761 CmdArgFlags status{CmdArgFlags::NONE};
762};
763
764Command::Command(char *cur_arg, const CmdFile a_mode) :
765 arg(cur_arg),
766 mode(a_mode),
767 value(std::strchr(&cur_arg[1], '='))
768{
769 lowerize_parameter(cur_arg);
770 int j;
771
772 if (value != nullptr)
773 {
774 j = static_cast<int>(value++ - cur_arg);
775 }
776 else
777 {
778 j = static_cast<int>(std::strlen(cur_arg));
779 value = cur_arg + j;
780 }
781 if (j > 20)
782 {
783 arg_error(cur_arg); // keyword too long
784 status = CmdArgFlags::BAD_ARG;
785 return;
786 }
787 variable = std::string(cur_arg, j);
788 value_len = static_cast<int>(std::strlen(value)); // note value's length
789 char_val[0] = value[0]; // first letter of value
790 yes_no_val[0] = -1; // note yes|no value
791 if (char_val[0] == 'n')
792 {
793 yes_no_val[0] = 0;
794 }
795 if (char_val[0] == 'y')
796 {
797 yes_no_val[0] = 1;
798 }
799
800 char *arg_ptr = value;
801 num_float_params = 0;
802 num_int_params = 0;
803 total_params = 0;
804 num_val = 0;
805 while (*arg_ptr) // count and pre-parse parms
806 {
807 long ll;
808 bool last_arg{};
809 char *arg_ptr2 = std::strchr(arg_ptr, '/');
810 if (arg_ptr2 == nullptr) // find next '/'
811 {
812 arg_ptr2 = arg_ptr + std::strlen(arg_ptr);
813 *arg_ptr2 = '/';
814 last_arg = true;
815 }
816 if (total_params == 0)
817 {
818 num_val = NON_NUMERIC;
819 }
820 if (total_params < 16)
821 {
822 char_val[total_params] = *arg_ptr; // first letter of value
823 if (char_val[total_params] == 'n')
824 {
825 yes_no_val[total_params] = 0;
826 }
827 if (char_val[total_params] == 'y')
828 {
829 yes_no_val[total_params] = 1;
830 }
831 }
832 char next{};
833 char tmp_c{};
834 if (std::sscanf(arg_ptr, "%c%c", &next, &tmp_c) > 0 // NULL entry
835 && (next == '/' || next == '=') && tmp_c == '/')
836 {
837 j = 0;
838 ++num_float_params;
839 ++num_int_params;
840 if (total_params < 16)
841 {
842 float_vals[total_params] = j;
843 float_val_strs[total_params] = "0";
844 }
845 if (total_params < 64)
846 {
847 int_vals[total_params] = j;
848 }
849 if (total_params == 0)
850 {
851 num_val = j;
852 }
853 }
854 else if (std::sscanf(arg_ptr, "%ld%c", &ll, &tmp_c) > 0 // got an integer
855 && tmp_c == '/') // needs a long int, ll, here for lyapunov
856 {
857 ++num_float_params;
858 ++num_int_params;
859 if (total_params < 16)
860 {
861 float_vals[total_params] = ll;
862 float_val_strs[total_params] = arg_ptr;
863 }
864 if (total_params < 64)
865 {
866 int_vals[total_params] = static_cast<int>(ll);
867 }
868 if (total_params == 0)
869 {
870 num_val = static_cast<int>(ll);
871 }
872 }
873 else if (double f_temp{}; std::sscanf(arg_ptr, "%lg%c", &f_temp, &tmp_c) > 0 // got a float
874 && tmp_c == '/')
875 {
876 ++num_float_params;
877 if (total_params < 16)
878 {
879 float_vals[total_params] = f_temp;
880 float_val_strs[total_params] = arg_ptr;
881 }
882 }
883 // using arbitrary precision and above failed
884 else if (static_cast<int>(std::strlen(arg_ptr)) > 513 // very long command
885 || (total_params > 0 && float_vals[total_params - 1] == FLT_MAX && total_params < 6) || is_a_big_float(arg_ptr))
886 {
887 ++num_float_params;
888 float_vals[total_params] = FLT_MAX;
889 float_val_strs[total_params] = arg_ptr;
890 }
891 ++total_params;
892 arg_ptr = arg_ptr2; // on to the next
893 if (last_arg)
894 {
895 *arg_ptr = 0;
896 }
897 else
898 {
899 ++arg_ptr;
900 }
901 }
902}
903CmdArgFlags Command::bad_arg() const
904{
905 arg_error(arg);
906 return CmdArgFlags::BAD_ARG;
907}
908
909void Command::init_msg() const
910{
911 engine::init_msg(variable.c_str(), value, mode);
912}

986static CmdArgFlags cmd_make_doc(const Command &cmd)
987{
988 enum
989 {
990 BOX_ROW = 6,
991 BOX_COL = 11,
992 BOX_WIDTH = 57,
993 BOX_DEPTH = 12,
994 };
995 help_title();
996 driver_set_attr(1, 0, C_DVID_BKGRD, 24 * 80); // init rest to background
997 // init box
998 for (int i = 0; i < BOX_DEPTH; ++i)
999 {
1000 driver_set_attr(BOX_ROW + i, BOX_COL, C_DVID_LO, BOX_WIDTH);
1001 }
1002 driver_put_string(BOX_ROW + 2, BOX_COL + 4, C_DVID_HI, "Creating Help Document");
1003 const std::string file{*cmd.value ? cmd.value : "id.txt"};
1004 driver_put_string(BOX_ROW + 4, BOX_COL + 4, C_DVID_LO, "Save name: " + file);
1005 driver_put_string(BOX_ROW + 6, BOX_COL + 4, C_DVID_LO, "Status:");
1006 cmd_files_test::s_print_document(file.c_str(), make_doc_msg_func);
1007 cmd_files_test::s_goodbye();
1008 return CmdArgFlags::GOODBYE;
1009}
1010
1011static CmdArgFlags cmd_make_par(const Command &cmd)
1012{
1013 if (cmd.total_params < 1 || cmd.total_params > 2)
1014 {
1015 return cmd.bad_arg();
1016 }
1017 std::string par_file{cmd.value};
1018 std::string entry_name;
1019 if (char *slash = std::strchr(cmd.value, '/'); slash != nullptr)
1020 {
1021 par_file.assign(cmd.value, slash);
1022 entry_name.assign(slash + 1);
1023 }
1024
1025 g_parameter_file = par_file;
1026 if (!g_parameter_file.has_extension())
1027 {
1028 g_parameter_file.replace_extension(".par");
1029 }
1030 if (entry_name.empty())
1031 {
1032 if (!g_read_filename.empty())
1033 {
1034 g_parameter_set_name = g_read_filename.filename().string();
1035 }
1036 else if (!g_map_name.empty())
1037 {
1038 g_parameter_set_name = g_map_name;
1039 }
1040 else
1041 {
1042 return cmd.bad_arg();
1043 }
1044 }
1045 else
1046 {
1047 g_parameter_set_name = entry_name;
1048 assert(g_parameter_set_name.length() <= ITEM_NAME_LEN);
1049 if (g_parameter_set_name.length() > ITEM_NAME_LEN)
1050 {
1051 g_parameter_set_name.resize(ITEM_NAME_LEN);
1052 }
1053 }
1054 g_make_parameter_file = true;
1055 if (!g_read_filename.empty())
1056 {
1057 if (read_overlay() != 0)
1058 {
1059 cmd_files_test::s_goodbye();
1060 return CmdArgFlags::GOODBYE;
1061 }
1062 }
1063 else if (!g_map_name.empty())
1064 {
1065 g_make_parameter_file_map = true;
1066 }
1067 g_logical_screen.x_dots = g_file_x_dots;
1068 g_logical_screen.y_dots = g_file_y_dots;
1069 g_logical_screen.x_size_dots = g_logical_screen.x_dots - 1;
1070 g_logical_screen.y_size_dots = g_logical_screen.y_dots - 1;
1071 calc_frac_init();
1072 make_batch_file();
1073 cmd_files_test::s_goodbye();
1074 return CmdArgFlags::GOODBYE;
1075}

1131// 3d=?/?/..
1132static CmdArgFlags cmd_3d(const Command &cmd)
1133{
1134 const std::string_view value{cmd.value};
1135 int yes_no = cmd.yes_no_val[0];
1136 if (value == "overlay")
1137 {
1138 yes_no = 1;
1139 if (g_calc_status > CalcStatus::NO_FRACTAL) // if no image, treat same as 3D=yes
1140 {
1141 g_overlay_3d = true;
1142 }
1143 }
1144 else if (yes_no < 0)
1145 {
1146 return cmd.bad_arg();
1147 }
1148 g_display_3d = yes_no != 0 ? Display3DMode::YES : Display3DMode::NONE;
1149 init_vars3d();
1150 return g_display_3d != Display3DMode::NONE ? CmdArgFlags::PARAM_3D | CmdArgFlags::YES_3D
1151 : CmdArgFlags::PARAM_3D;
1152}

1166 {
1167 return cmd.bad_arg();
1168 }

1170 return CmdArgFlags::FRACTAL_PARAM;
1171}

1283 g_background_color[1] = static_cast<Byte>(cmd.int_vals[1]);

1285 return CmdArgFlags::PARAM_3D;

1301{
1302 if (const std::string_view value{cmd.value}; value == "mod")
1303 {
1304 g_bailout_test = Bailout::MOD;
1305 }
1306 else if (value == "real")
1307 {
1308 g_bailout_test = Bailout::REAL;
1309 }
1310 else if (value == "imag")
1311 {
1312 g_bailout_test = Bailout::IMAG;
1313 }
1314 else if (value == "or")
1315 {
1316 g_bailout_test = Bailout::OR;
1317 }
1318 else if (value == "and")
1319 {
1320 g_bailout_test = Bailout::AND;
1321 }
1322 else if (value == "manh")
1323 {
1324 g_bailout_test = Bailout::MANH;
1325 }
1326 else if (value == "manr")
1327 {
1328 g_bailout_test = Bailout::MANR;
1329 }
1330 else
1331 {
1332 return cmd.bad_arg();
1333 }
1334 set_bailout_formula(g_bailout_test);
1335 return CmdArgFlags::FRACTAL_PARAM;
1336}

1367static CmdArgFlags cmd_bright(const Command &cmd)
1368{
1369 if (cmd.total_params != 2 || cmd.num_int_params != 2)
1370 {
1371 return cmd.bad_arg();
1372 }
1373 g_red_bright = cmd.int_vals[0];
1374 g_blue_bright = cmd.int_vals[1];
1375 return CmdArgFlags::FRACTAL_PARAM | CmdArgFlags::PARAM_3D;
1376}
1377
1378// center-mag=[Xctr/Yctr/Mag[/Xmagfactor/Rotation/Skew]]
1379static CmdArgFlags cmd_center_mag(const Command &cmd)
1380{
1381 if (cmd.total_params != cmd.num_float_params || (cmd.total_params != 0 && cmd.total_params < 3) ||
1382 (cmd.total_params >= 3 && cmd.float_vals[2] == 0.0))
1383 {
1384 return cmd.bad_arg();
1385 }
1386 if (g_fractal_type == FractalType::CELLULAR)
1387 {
1388 return CmdArgFlags::FRACTAL_PARAM; // skip setting the corners
1389 }
1390
1391 g_use_center_mag = true;
1392 if (cmd.total_params == 0)
1393 {
1394 return CmdArgFlags::NONE; // turns center-mag mode on
1395 }
1396 s_init_corners = true;
1397 // dec = get_max_curarg_len(floatvalstr, totparms);
1398 LDouble magnification;
1399 std::sscanf(cmd.float_val_strs[2], "%Lf", &magnification);
1400
1401 // I don't know if this is portable, but something needs to
1402 // be used in case compiler's LDBL_MAX is not big enough
1403 if (magnification > LDBL_MAX || magnification < -LDBL_MAX)
1404 {
1405 return cmd.bad_arg(); // ie: magnification is +-1.#INF
1406 }
1407
1408 const int dec = get_magnification_precision(magnification);
1409
1410 if ((dec <= DBL_DIG + 1 && g_debug_flag != DebugFlags::FORCE_ARBITRARY_PRECISION_MATH) ||
1411 g_debug_flag == DebugFlags::PREVENT_ARBITRARY_PRECISION_MATH)
1412 {
1413 // rough estimate that double is OK
1414 const double x_ctr = cmd.float_vals[0];
1415 const double y_ctr = cmd.float_vals[1];
1416 double x_mag_factor = 1;
1417 double rotation = 0;
1418 double skew = 0;
1419 if (cmd.num_float_params > 3)
1420 {
1421 x_mag_factor = cmd.float_vals[3];
1422 }
1423 if (x_mag_factor == 0)
1424 {
1425 x_mag_factor = 1;
1426 }
1427 if (cmd.num_float_params > 4)
1428 {
1429 rotation = cmd.float_vals[4];
1430 }
1431 if (cmd.num_float_params > 5)
1432 {
1433 skew = cmd.float_vals[5];
1434 }
1435 // calculate bounds
1436 cvt_corners(x_ctr, y_ctr, magnification, x_mag_factor, rotation, skew);
1437 return CmdArgFlags::FRACTAL_PARAM;
1438 }
1439
1440 // use arbitrary precision
1441 s_init_corners = true;
1442 const BFMathType old_bf_math = g_bf_math;
1443 if (g_bf_math == BFMathType::NONE || dec > g_decimals)
1444 {
1445 init_bf_dec(dec);
1446 }
1447 if (old_bf_math == BFMathType::NONE)
1448 {
1449 for (int k = 0; k < MAX_PARAMS; k++)
1450 {
1451 float_to_bf(g_bf_params[k], g_params[k]);
1452 }
1453 }
1454 g_use_center_mag = true;
1455 BigStackSaver saved;
1456 BigFloat b_x_ctr = alloc_stack(g_bf_length + 2);
1457 BigFloat b_y_ctr = alloc_stack(g_bf_length + 2);
1458 get_bf(b_x_ctr, cmd.float_val_strs[0]);
1459 get_bf(b_y_ctr, cmd.float_val_strs[1]);
1460 double x_mag_factor = 1;
1461 double rotation = 0;
1462 double skew = 0;
1463 if (cmd.num_float_params > 3)
1464 {
1465 x_mag_factor = cmd.float_vals[3];
1466 }
1467 if (x_mag_factor == 0)
1468 {
1469 x_mag_factor = 1;
1470 }
1471 if (cmd.num_float_params > 4)
1472 {
1473 rotation = cmd.float_vals[4];
1474 }
1475 if (cmd.num_float_params > 5)
1476 {
1477 skew = cmd.float_vals[5];
1478 }
1479 // calculate bounds
1480 cvt_corners_bf(b_x_ctr, b_y_ctr, magnification, x_mag_factor, rotation, skew);
1481 bf_corners_to_float();
1482 return CmdArgFlags::FRACTAL_PARAM;
1483}

1495
1496static int decode_hex_digit(const int ch)
1497{
1498 static constexpr char HEX_DIGITS[]{"0123456789abcdef"};
1499 const char *pos = std::strchr(HEX_DIGITS, std::tolower(ch));
1500 return pos == nullptr ? -1 : static_cast<int>(pos - HEX_DIGITS);
1501}
1502
1503static int parse_hex_color(const char *&value)
1504{
1505 if (!*value)
1506 {
1507 return -1;
1508 }
1509 const int high = decode_hex_digit(*value++);
1510 if (!*value || high == -1)
1511 {
1512 return -1;
1513 }
1514 const int low = decode_hex_digit(*value++);
1515 if (low == -1)
1516 {
1517 return -1;
1518 }
1519 return high * 16 + low;
1520 }
1521
1522static int parse_6bit_color(const char *&value)
1523{
1524 int k = *value++;
1525 if (k < '0')
1526 {
1527 return -1;
1528 }
1529 if (k <= '9')
1530 {
1531 k -= '0';
1532 }
1533 else if (k < 'A')
1534 {
1535 return -1;
1536 }
1537 else if (k <= 'Z')
1538 {
1539 k -= 'A' - 10;
1540 }
1541 else if (k < '_' || k > 'z')
1542 {
1543 return -1;
1544 }
1545 else
1546 {
1547 k -= '_' - 36;
1548 }
1549 return k * 4; // move value to high 6 bits.
1550}
1551
1552static CmdArgFlags parse_colors(const char *value)
1553{
1554 if (*value == '@')
1555 {
1556 if (const fs::path path{find_file(ReadFile::MAP, &value[1])}; !path.empty())
1557 {
1558 g_map_name = path.filename().string();
1559 }
1560 else
1561 {
1562 init_msg("", &value[1], CmdFile::AT_CMD_LINE_SET_NAME);
1563 }
1564 if (validate_luts(g_map_name))
1565 {
1566 goto bad_color;
1567 }
1568 if (g_display_3d != Display3DMode::NONE)
1569 {
1570 g_map_set = true;
1571 }
1572 else
1573 {
1574 g_last_map_name = &value[1];
1575 g_color_state = ColorState::MAP_FILE;
1576 }
1577 }
1578 else
1579 {
1580 int smooth{};
1581 int i{};
1582 while (*value)
1583 {
1584 if (i >= 256)
1585 {
1586 goto bad_color;
1587 }
1588 if (*value == '<')
1589 {
1590 if (i == 0
1591 || smooth
1592 || (smooth = std::atoi(value+1)) < 2
1593 || (value = std::strchr(value, '>')) == nullptr)
1594 {
1595 goto bad_color;
1596 }
1597 i += smooth;
1598 ++value;
1599 }
1600 else
1601 {
1602 const bool hex_color{*value == '#'};
1603 if (hex_color)
1604 {
1605 ++value;
1606 }
1607 for (int j = 0; j < 3; ++j)
1608 {
1609 const int k = hex_color ? parse_hex_color(value) : parse_6bit_color(value);
1610 if (k == -1)
1611 {
1612 goto bad_color;
1613 }
1614 g_dac_box[i][j] = static_cast<Byte>(k);
1615 if (smooth)
1616 {
1617 const int spread = smooth + 1;
1618 const int start = i - spread;
1619 int c_num{};
1620 if (k - static_cast<int>(g_dac_box[start][j]) == 0)
1621 {
1622 while (++c_num < spread)
1623 {
1624 g_dac_box[start+c_num][j] = static_cast<Byte>(k);
1625 }
1626 }
1627 else
1628 {
1629 while (++c_num < spread)
1630 {
1631 g_dac_box[start+c_num][j] =
1632 static_cast<Byte>(
1633 (c_num * g_dac_box[i][j] + (i - (start + c_num)) * g_dac_box[start][j] +
1634 spread / 2) /
1635 static_cast<Byte>(spread));
1636 }
1637 }
1638 }
1639 }
1640 smooth = 0;
1641 ++i;
1642 }
1643 }
1644 if (smooth)
1645 {
1646 goto bad_color;
1647 }
1648 while (i < 256)
1649 {
1650 // zap unset entries
1651 g_dac_box[i][0] = 40;
1652 g_dac_box[i][1] = 40;
1653 g_dac_box[i][2] = 40;
1654 ++i;
1655 }
1656 g_color_state = ColorState::UNKNOWN_MAP;
1657 }
1658 g_colors_preloaded = true;
1659 std::memcpy(g_old_dac_box, g_dac_box, 256*3);
1660 return CmdArgFlags::NONE;
1661bad_color:
1662 return CmdArgFlags::BAD_ARG;
1663}
1664
1665// colors=, set current colors
1666static CmdArgFlags cmd_colors(const Command &cmd)
1667{
1668 if (parse_colors(cmd.value) == CmdArgFlags::BAD_ARG)
1669 {
1670 return cmd.bad_arg();
1671 }
1672 return CmdArgFlags::NONE;
1673}

1678 return CmdArgFlags::NONE;

1687
1688// corners=?/?/?/?
1689static CmdArgFlags cmd_corners(const Command &cmd)
1690{
1691 if (g_fractal_type == FractalType::CELLULAR)
1692 {
1693 return CmdArgFlags::FRACTAL_PARAM; // skip setting the corners
1694 }
1695
1696 if (cmd.num_float_params != cmd.total_params || (cmd.total_params != 0 && cmd.total_params != 4 && cmd.total_params != 6))
1697 {
1698 return cmd.bad_arg();
1699 }
1700
1701 g_use_center_mag = false;
1702 if (cmd.total_params == 0)
1703 {
1704 return CmdArgFlags::NONE; // turns corners mode on
1705 }
1706
1707 s_init_corners = true;
1708 // good first approx, but dec could be too big
1709 if (int dec = get_max_cur_arg_len(cmd.float_val_strs, cmd.total_params) + 1;
1710 (dec > DBL_DIG + 1 || g_debug_flag == DebugFlags::FORCE_ARBITRARY_PRECISION_MATH) &&
1711 g_debug_flag != DebugFlags::PREVENT_ARBITRARY_PRECISION_MATH)
1712 {
1713 const BFMathType old_bf_math = g_bf_math;
1714 if (g_bf_math == BFMathType::NONE || dec > g_decimals)
1715 {
1716 init_bf_dec(dec);
1717 }
1718 if (old_bf_math == BFMathType::NONE)
1719 {
1720 for (int k = 0; k < MAX_PARAMS; k++)
1721 {
1722 float_to_bf(g_bf_params[k], g_params[k]);
1723 }
1724 }
1725
1726 // xx3rd = xxmin = floatval[0];
1727 get_bf(g_bf_x_min, cmd.float_val_strs[0]);
1728 get_bf(g_bf_x_3rd, cmd.float_val_strs[0]);
1729
1730 // xxmax = floatval[1];
1731 get_bf(g_bf_x_max, cmd.float_val_strs[1]);
1732
1733 // yy3rd = yymin = floatval[2];
1734 get_bf(g_bf_y_min, cmd.float_val_strs[2]);
1735 get_bf(g_bf_y_3rd, cmd.float_val_strs[2]);
1736
1737 // yymax = floatval[3];
1738 get_bf(g_bf_y_max, cmd.float_val_strs[3]);
1739
1740 if (cmd.total_params == 6)
1741 {
1742 // xx3rd = floatval[4];
1743 get_bf(g_bf_x_3rd, cmd.float_val_strs[4]);
1744
1745 // yy3rd = floatval[5];
1746 get_bf(g_bf_y_3rd, cmd.float_val_strs[5]);
1747 }
1748
1749 // now that all the corners have been read in, get a more
1750 // accurate value for dec and do it all again
1751
1752 dec = get_prec_bf_mag();
1753 if (dec < 0)
1754 {
1755 return cmd.bad_arg(); // ie: magnification is +-1.#INF
1756 }
1757
1758 if (dec > g_decimals) // get corners again if we need more precision
1759 {
1760 init_bf_dec(dec);
1761
1762 // now get parameters and corners all over again at new
1763 // decimal setting
1764 for (int k = 0; k < MAX_PARAMS; k++)
1765 {
1766 float_to_bf(g_bf_params[k], g_params[k]);
1767 }
1768
1769 // xx3rd = xxmin = floatval[0];
1770 get_bf(g_bf_x_min, cmd.float_val_strs[0]);
1771 get_bf(g_bf_x_3rd, cmd.float_val_strs[0]);
1772
1773 // xxmax = floatval[1];
1774 get_bf(g_bf_x_max, cmd.float_val_strs[1]);
1775
1776 // yy3rd = yymin = floatval[2];
1777 get_bf(g_bf_y_min, cmd.float_val_strs[2]);
1778 get_bf(g_bf_y_3rd, cmd.float_val_strs[2]);
1779
1780 // yymax = floatval[3];
1781 get_bf(g_bf_y_max, cmd.float_val_strs[3]);
1782
1783 if (cmd.total_params == 6)
1784 {
1785 // xx3rd = floatval[4];
1786 get_bf(g_bf_x_3rd, cmd.float_val_strs[4]);
1787
1788 // yy3rd = floatval[5];
1789 get_bf(g_bf_y_3rd, cmd.float_val_strs[5]);
1790 }
1791 }
1792 }
1793 g_image_region.m_min.x = cmd.float_vals[0];
1794 g_image_region.m_3rd.x = cmd.float_vals[0];
1795 g_image_region.m_max.x = cmd.float_vals[1];
1796 g_image_region.m_min.y = cmd.float_vals[2];
1797 g_image_region.m_3rd.y = cmd.float_vals[2];
1798 g_image_region.m_max.y = cmd.float_vals[3];
1799
1800 if (cmd.total_params == 6)
1801 {
1802 g_image_region.m_3rd.x = cmd.float_vals[4];
1803 g_image_region.m_3rd.y = cmd.float_vals[5];
1804 }
1805 return CmdArgFlags::FRACTAL_PARAM;
1806}

1846static CmdArgFlags cmd_cycle_range(const Command &cmd)
1847{

1850 {
1851 end = 255;
1852 }

1854 if (cmd.total_params < 1)
1855 {
1856 begin = 1;
1857 }
1858 if (cmd.total_params != cmd.num_int_params || begin < 0 || end > 255 || begin > end)
1859 {
1860 return cmd.bad_arg();
1861 }
1862 g_color_cycle_range_lo = begin;
1863 g_color_cycle_range_hi = end;
1864 return CmdArgFlags::NONE;
1865}

1947static CmdArgFlags cmd_filename(const Command &cmd)
1948{
1949 if (cmd.char_val[0] == '.' && cmd.value[1] != SLASH_CH)
1950 {
1951 g_image_filename_mask = std::string{"*"} + cmd.value;
1952 return CmdArgFlags::NONE;
1953 }
1954 if (cmd.value_len > ID_FILE_MAX_PATH - 1)
1955 {
1956 return cmd.bad_arg();
1957 }
1958 if (cmd.mode == CmdFile::AT_AFTER_STARTUP &&
1959 g_display_3d == Display3DMode::NONE) // can't do this in @ command
1960 {
1961 return cmd.bad_arg();
1962 }
1963
1964 g_read_filename = find_file(ReadFile::IMAGE, cmd.value);
1965 if (!g_read_filename.empty())
1966 {
1967 g_show_file = ShowFile::LOAD_IMAGE;
1968 g_browse.name = g_read_filename.filename().string();
1969 }
1970 else
1971 {
1972 cmd.init_msg();
1973 }
1974 return CmdArgFlags::FRACTAL_PARAM | CmdArgFlags::PARAM_3D;
1975}

2060 return cmd.bad_arg();
2061 }
2062 g_targa_out = cmd.yes_no_val[0] != 0;
2063 return CmdArgFlags::PARAM_3D;
2064}
2065
2066static CmdArgFlags cmd_function(const Command &cmd)
2067{
2068 int k = 0;
2069 const char *value = cmd.value;
2070 while (*value && k < 4)
2071 {
2072 if (set_trig_array(k++, value))
2073 {
2074 return cmd.bad_arg();
2075 }
2076 value = std::strchr(value, '/');
2077 if (value == nullptr)
2078 {
2079 break;
2080 }
2081 ++value;
2082 }
2083 g_new_bifurcation_functions_loaded = true; // for old bifs
2084 s_init_functions = true;
2085 return CmdArgFlags::FRACTAL_PARAM;
2086}

2405{
2406 g_log_map_fly_calculate = LogMapCalculate::NONE; // turn off if error
2407 g_log_map_auto_calculate = false;
2408 if (cmd.char_val[0] == 'f')
2409 {
2410 g_log_map_fly_calculate = LogMapCalculate::ON_THE_FLY; // calculate on the fly
2411 }
2412 else if (cmd.char_val[0] == 't')
2413 {
2414 g_log_map_fly_calculate = LogMapCalculate::USE_LOG_TABLE; // force use of LogTable
2415 }
2416 else if (cmd.char_val[0] == 'a')
2417 {
2418 g_log_map_auto_calculate = true; // force auto calc of logmap
2419 }
2420 else
2421 {
2422 return cmd.bad_arg();
2423 }
2424 return CmdArgFlags::FRACTAL_PARAM;

2513// miim=?[/?[/?[/?]]]
2514static CmdArgFlags cmd_miim(const Command &cmd)
2515{
2516 if (cmd.total_params > 6)
2517 {
2518 return cmd.bad_arg();
2519 }
2520 if (cmd.char_val[0] == 'b')
2521 {
2522 g_major_method = Major::BREADTH_FIRST;
2523 }
2524 else if (cmd.char_val[0] == 'd')
2525 {
2526 g_major_method = Major::DEPTH_FIRST;
2527 }
2528 else if (cmd.char_val[0] == 'w')
2529 {
2530 g_major_method = Major::RANDOM_WALK;
2531 }
2532#ifdef RANDOM_RUN
2533 else if (cmd.charval[0] == 'r')
2534 {
2535 major_method = Major::random_run;
2536 }
2537#endif
2538 else
2539 {
2540 return cmd.bad_arg();
2541 }
2542
2543 if (cmd.char_val[1] == 'l')
2544 {
2545 g_inverse_julia_minor_method = Minor::LEFT_FIRST;
2546 }
2547 else if (cmd.char_val[1] == 'r')
2548 {
2549 g_inverse_julia_minor_method = Minor::RIGHT_FIRST;
2550 }
2551 else
2552 {
2553 return cmd.bad_arg();
2554 }
2555
2556 // keep this next part in for backwards compatibility with old PARs ???
2557
2558 if (cmd.total_params > 2)
2559 {
2560 for (int k = 2; k < 6; ++k)
2561 {
2562 g_params[k - 2] = k < cmd.total_params ? cmd.float_vals[k] : 0.0;
2563 }
2564 }
2565
2566 return CmdArgFlags::FRACTAL_PARAM;
2567}

2706static CmdArgFlags cmd_outside(const Command &cmd)
2707{
2708 struct Outside
2709 {
2710 std::string_view arg;
2711 ColorMethod outside;
2712 };
2713 static const Outside OUTSIDES[] = {
2714 {"iter", ColorMethod::ITER}, //
2715 {"real", ColorMethod::REAL}, //
2716 {"imag", ColorMethod::IMAG}, //
2717 {"mult", ColorMethod::MULT}, //
2718 {"summ", ColorMethod::SUM}, //
2719 {"atan", ColorMethod::ATAN}, //
2720 {"fmod", ColorMethod::FMOD}, //
2721 {"tdis", ColorMethod::TDIS} //
2722 };
2723 for (const auto &[arg, outside] : OUTSIDES)
2724 {
2725 if (cmd.value == arg)
2726 {
2727 g_outside_method = outside;
2728 g_outside_color = -1;
2729 return CmdArgFlags::FRACTAL_PARAM;
2730 }
2731 }
2732 if (cmd.num_val == NON_NUMERIC || cmd.num_val < +ColorMethod::TDIS || cmd.num_val > 255)
2733 {
2734 return cmd.bad_arg();
2735 }
2736 g_outside_method = ColorMethod::COLOR;
2737 g_outside_color = cmd.num_val;
2738 return CmdArgFlags::FRACTAL_PARAM;
2739}

2750
2751static CmdArgFlags cmd_params(const Command &cmd)
2752{
2753 if (cmd.total_params != cmd.num_float_params || cmd.total_params > MAX_PARAMS)
2754 {
2755 return cmd.bad_arg();
2756 }
2757 s_init_params = true;
2758 for (int k = 0; k < MAX_PARAMS; ++k)
2759 {
2760 g_params[k] = k < cmd.total_params ? cmd.float_vals[k] : 0.0;
2761 }
2762 if (g_bf_math != BFMathType::NONE)
2763 {
2764 for (int k = 0; k < MAX_PARAMS; k++)
2765 {
2766 float_to_bf(g_bf_params[k], g_params[k]);
2767 }
2768 }
2769 return CmdArgFlags::FRACTAL_PARAM;
2770}

2802 g_stop_pass = static_cast<int>(cmd.value[1]) - static_cast<int>('0');

2877static CmdArgFlags cmd_potential(const Command &cmd)
2878{
2879 int k{};
2880 const char *value = cmd.value;
2881 while (k < 3 && *value)
2882 {
2883 if (k == 1)
2884 {
2885 g_potential.params[k] = std::atof(value);
2886 }
2887 else
2888 {
2889 g_potential.params[k] = std::atoi(value);
2890 }
2891 k++;
2892 value = std::strchr(value, '/');
2893 if (value == nullptr)
2894 {
2895 k = 99;
2896 }
2897 else
2898 {
2899 ++value;
2900 }
2901 }
2902 g_potential.store_16bit = false;
2903 if (k < 99)
2904 {
2905 if (std::string_view{value} != "16bit")
2906 {
2907 return cmd.bad_arg();
2908 }
2909 g_potential.store_16bit = true;
2910 }
2911 return CmdArgFlags::FRACTAL_PARAM;
2912}

2953// ranges=?/?/.../?
2954static CmdArgFlags cmd_ranges(const Command &cmd)
2955{
2956 if (cmd.total_params != cmd.num_int_params)
2957 {
2958 return cmd.bad_arg();
2959 }
2960
2961 int prev = 0;
2962 g_log_map_flag = 0; // ranges overrides logmap
2963 std::vector<int> tmp_ranges;
2964 for (int i = 0; i < cmd.total_params; ++i)
2965 {
2966 int k = cmd.int_vals[i];
2967 if (k < 0) // striping
2968 {
2969 k = -k;
2970 if (k >= 16384 || i == cmd.total_params - 1)
2971 {
2972 return cmd.bad_arg();
2973 }
2974 tmp_ranges.push_back(-1); // {-1,width,limit} for striping
2975 tmp_ranges.push_back(k);
2976 k = cmd.int_vals[i + 1];
2977 ++i;
2978 }
2979 if (k < prev)
2980 {
2981 return cmd.bad_arg();
2982 }
2983 prev = k;
2984 tmp_ranges.push_back(k);
2985 }
2986 if (prev == 0)
2987 {
2988 return cmd.bad_arg();
2989 }
2990 g_iteration_ranges = std::move(tmp_ranges);
2991 return CmdArgFlags::FRACTAL_PARAM;
2992}

3057
3058static CmdArgFlags cmd_reset(const Command &cmd)
3059{
3060 // PAR release unknown unless specified
3061 if (cmd.num_val < 0)
3062 {
3063 return cmd.bad_arg();
3064 }
3065
3066 init_vars_fractal();
3067 if (cmd.num_int_params == 1)
3068 {
3069 // Id version: reset=100, reset=101; legacy version: reset=1960
3070 if (cmd.int_vals[0] >= 100)
3071 {
3072 g_release = cmd.int_vals[0];
3073 g_version.major = g_release / 100;
3074 g_version.minor = g_release % 100;
3075 g_version.patch = 0;
3076 g_version.tweak = 0;
3077 g_version.legacy = cmd.int_vals[0] != 100 && cmd.int_vals[0] != 101;
3078 }
3079 // Id version: reset=<major>
3080 else
3081 {
3082 g_release = cmd.int_vals[0] * 100;
3083 g_version = Version{};
3084 g_version.major = cmd.int_vals[0];
3085 }
3086 }
3087 // Id version: reset=<major>/<minor>[/<patch>[/<tweak>]]
3088 else if (cmd.num_int_params > 1)
3089 {
3090 g_release = cmd.int_vals[0] * 100 + cmd.int_vals[1];
3091 g_version = Version{};
3092 g_version.major = cmd.int_vals[0];
3093 g_version.minor = cmd.int_vals[1];
3094 if (cmd.num_int_params > 2)
3095 {
3096 g_version.patch = cmd.int_vals[2];
3097 }
3098 if (cmd.num_int_params > 3)
3099 {
3100 g_version.tweak = cmd.int_vals[3];
3101 }
3102 }
3103 return CmdArgFlags::FRACTAL_PARAM | CmdArgFlags::RESET;
3104}

3269// sound=?[/?/?/?/?]
3270static CmdArgFlags cmd_sound(const Command &cmd)
3271{
3272 if (cmd.total_params > 5)
3273 {
3274 return cmd.bad_arg();
3275 }
3276 g_sound_flag = SOUNDFLAG_OFF; // start with a clean slate, add bits as we go
3277 if (cmd.total_params == 1)
3278 {
3279 g_sound_flag = SOUNDFLAG_SPEAKER; // old command, default to PC speaker
3280 }
3281
3282 // g_sound_flag is used as a bitfield... bit 0,1,2 used for whether sound
3283 // is modified by an orbits x,y,or z component. and also to turn it on
3284 // or off (0==off, 1==beep (or yes), 2==x, 3==y, 4==z),
3285 // Bit 3 is used for flagging the PC speaker sound,
3286 // Bit 4 for OPL3 FM sound card output,
3287 // Bit 5 will be for midi output (not yet),
3288 // Bit 6 for whether the tone is quantised to the nearest 'proper' note
3289 // (according to the western, even tempered system anyway)
3290 if (cmd.char_val[0] == 'n' || cmd.char_val[0] == 'o')
3291 {
3292 g_sound_flag &= ~SOUNDFLAG_ORBIT_MASK;
3293 }
3294 else if (std::strncmp(cmd.value, "ye", 2) == 0 || cmd.char_val[0] == 'b')
3295 {
3296 g_sound_flag |= SOUNDFLAG_BEEP;
3297 }
3298 else if (cmd.char_val[0] == 'x')
3299 {
3300 g_sound_flag |= SOUNDFLAG_X;
3301 }
3302 else if (cmd.char_val[0] == 'y' && std::strncmp(cmd.value, "ye", 2) != 0)
3303 {
3304 g_sound_flag |= SOUNDFLAG_Y;
3305 }
3306 else if (cmd.char_val[0] == 'z')
3307 {
3308 g_sound_flag |= SOUNDFLAG_Z;
3309 }
3310 else
3311 {
3312 return cmd.bad_arg();
3313 }
3314 if (cmd.total_params > 1)
3315 {
3316 g_sound_flag &= SOUNDFLAG_ORBIT_MASK; // reset options
3317 for (int i = 1; i < cmd.total_params; i++)
3318 {
3319 // this is for 2 or more options at the same time
3320 if (cmd.char_val[i] == 'f')
3321 {
3322 // (try to)switch on opl3 fm synth
3323 if (driver_init_fm())
3324 {
3325 g_sound_flag |= SOUNDFLAG_OPL3_FM;
3326 }
3327 else
3328 {
3329 g_sound_flag &= ~SOUNDFLAG_OPL3_FM;
3330 }
3331 }
3332 else if (cmd.char_val[i] == 'p')
3333 {
3334 g_sound_flag |= SOUNDFLAG_SPEAKER;
3335 }
3336 else if (cmd.char_val[i] == 'm')
3337 {
3338 g_sound_flag |= SOUNDFLAG_MIDI;
3339 }
3340 else if (cmd.char_val[i] == 'q')
3341 {
3342 g_sound_flag |= SOUNDFLAG_QUANTIZED;
3343 }
3344 else
3345 {
3346 return cmd.bad_arg();
3347 }
3348 } // end for
3349 } // end totparms > 1
3350 return CmdArgFlags::NONE;
3351}

3476 g_text_color[11] = BLACK * 16 + LT_WHITE;
3477 g_text_color[5] = BLACK * 16 + LT_WHITE;
3478 g_text_color[2] = BLACK * 16 + LT_WHITE;
3479 g_text_color[0] = BLACK * 16 + LT_WHITE;
3480 }
3481 else
3482 {
3483 std::size_t k{};
3484 while (k < std::size(g_text_color))
3485 {
3486 if (*value == 0)
3487 {
3488 break;
3489 }
3490 if (*value != '/')
3491 {
3492 unsigned int hex_val;
3493 std::sscanf(value, "%x", &hex_val);
3494 const unsigned int i = hex_val / 16 & 7;
3495 unsigned int j = hex_val & 15;
3496 if (i == j || (i == 0 && j == 8)) // force contrast
3497 {
3498 j = 15;
3499 }
3500 g_text_color[k] = static_cast<Byte>(i * 16 + j);
3501 value = std::strchr(value, '/');
3502 if (value == nullptr)
3503 {
3504 break;
3505 }
3506 }
3507 ++value;
3508 ++k;
3509 }
3510 }
3511
3512 return CmdArgFlags::NONE;
3513}

3566
3567static CmdArgFlags cmd_type(const Command &cmd)
3568{
3569 std::string value{cmd.value, static_cast<std::string::size_type>(cmd.value_len)};
3570 if (!value.empty() && value.back() == '*')
3571 {
3572 value.pop_back();
3573 }
3574
3575 // kludge because type ifs3d has an asterisk in front
3576 if (value == "ifs3d")
3577 {
3578 value = "ifs";
3579 }
3580 FractalType type{FractalType::NO_FRACTAL};
3581 for (int i = 0; i < g_num_fractal_types; ++i)
3582 {
3583 if (value == g_fractal_specific[i].name)
3584 {
3585 type = g_fractal_specific[i].type;
3586 break;
3587 }
3588 }
3589 if (type == FractalType::NO_FRACTAL)
3590 {
3591 return cmd.bad_arg();
3592 }
3593 const FractalType previous{g_fractal_type};
3594 set_fractal_type(type);
3595 if (!s_init_corners)
3596 {
3597 g_image_region.m_min.x = g_cur_fractal_specific->x_min;
3598 g_image_region.m_3rd.x = g_cur_fractal_specific->x_min;
3599 g_image_region.m_max.x = g_cur_fractal_specific->x_max;
3600 g_image_region.m_min.y = g_cur_fractal_specific->y_min;
3601 g_image_region.m_3rd.y = g_cur_fractal_specific->y_min;
3602 g_image_region.m_max.y = g_cur_fractal_specific->y_max;
3603 }
3604 if (!s_init_functions)
3605 {
3606 set_fractal_default_functions(previous);
3607 }
3608 if (!s_init_params)
3609 {
3610 load_params(g_fractal_type);
3611 }
3612 return CmdArgFlags::FRACTAL_PARAM;
3613}

3626static CmdArgFlags cmd_video(const Command &cmd)
3627{
3628 const int k = check_vid_mode_key_name(cmd.value);
3629 if (k == 0)
3630 {
3631 return cmd.bad_arg();
3632 }
3633 g_init_mode = -1;
3634 for (int i = 0; i < g_video_table_len; ++i)
3635 {
3636 if (g_video_table[i].key == k)
3637 {
3638 g_init_mode = i;
3639 break;
3640 }
3641 }
3642 if (g_init_mode == -1)
3643 {
3644 return cmd.bad_arg();
3645 }
3646 return CmdArgFlags::FRACTAL_PARAM | CmdArgFlags::PARAM_3D;
3647}

3649// viewwindows=?/?/?/?/?
3650static CmdArgFlags cmd_view_windows(const Command &cmd)
3651{
3652 if (cmd.total_params > 5 || cmd.num_float_params - cmd.num_int_params > 2 || cmd.num_int_params > 4)
3653 {
3654 return cmd.bad_arg();
3655 }
3656
3657 g_viewport.enabled = true;
3658 g_viewport.reduction = 4.2F; // reset default values
3659 g_viewport.final_aspect_ratio = g_screen_aspect;
3660 g_viewport.crop = true;
3661 g_viewport.x_dots = 0;
3662 g_viewport.y_dots = 0;
3663
3664 if (cmd.total_params > 0 && cmd.float_vals[0] > 0.001)
3665 {
3666 g_viewport.reduction = static_cast<float>(cmd.float_vals[0]);
3667 }
3668 if (cmd.total_params > 1 && cmd.float_vals[1] > 0.001)
3669 {
3670 g_viewport.final_aspect_ratio = static_cast<float>(cmd.float_vals[1]);
3671 }
3672 if (cmd.total_params > 2 && cmd.yes_no_val[2] == 0)
3673 {
3674 g_viewport.crop = cmd.yes_no_val[2] != 0;
3675 }
3676 if (cmd.total_params > 3 && cmd.int_vals[3] > 0)
3677 {
3678 g_viewport.x_dots = cmd.int_vals[3];
3679 }
3680 if (cmd.total_params == 5 && cmd.int_vals[4] > 0)
3681 {
3682 g_viewport.y_dots = cmd.int_vals[4];
3683 }
3684 return CmdArgFlags::FRACTAL_PARAM;
3685}

3933
3934template <size_t N>
3935static std::optional<CmdArgFlags> handle_command(const std::array<CommandHandler, N> &handlers, Command &cmd)
3936{
3937 if (auto it = std::lower_bound(handlers.begin(), handlers.end(), cmd.variable,
3938 [](const CommandHandler &handler, const std::string &name) { return handler.name < name; });
3939 it != handlers.end() && it->name == cmd.variable)
3940 {
3941 return it->handler(cmd);
3942 }
3943 return {};
3944}
3945
3946// cmdarg(string,mode) processes a single command-line/command-file argument
3947// return:
3948// -1 error, >= 0 ok
3949// if ok, return value:
3950// | 1 means fractal parm has been set
3951// | 2 means 3d parm has been set
3952// | 4 means 3d=yes specified
3953// | 8 means reset specified
3954//
3955CmdArgFlags cmd_arg(char *cur_arg, const CmdFile mode) // process a single argument
3956{
3957 Command cmd{cur_arg, mode};
3958 if (cmd.status != CmdArgFlags::NONE)
3959 {
3960 return cmd.status;
3961 }
3962
3963 if (mode != CmdFile::AT_AFTER_STARTUP || g_debug_flag == DebugFlags::ALLOW_INIT_COMMANDS_ANYTIME)
3964 {
3965 if (const std::optional handled{handle_command(s_startup_commands, cmd)}; handled.has_value())
3966 {
3967 return handled.value();
3968 }
3969 }
3970
3971 if (const std::optional handled{handle_command(s_commands, cmd)}; handled.has_value())
3972 {
3973 return handled.value();
3974 }
3975
3976 return cmd.bad_arg();
3977}
3978
3979static void arg_error(const char *bad_arg) // oops. couldn't decode this
3980{
3981 std::string spillover{bad_arg};
3982 if (spillover.length() > 70)
3983 {
3984 spillover = spillover.substr(0, 70);
3985 }
3986 std::string msg{"Oops. I couldn't understand the argument:\n "};
3987 msg += spillover;
3988
3989 if (g_first_init) // this is 1st call to cmdfiles
3990 {
3991 msg += "\n"
3992 "\n"
3993 "(see the Startup Help screens or documentation for a complete\n"
3994 " argument list with descriptions)";
3995 }
3996 cmd_files_test::s_stop_msg(StopMsgFlags::NONE, msg);
3997 if (g_init_batch != BatchMode::NONE)
3998 {
3999 g_init_batch = BatchMode::BAILOUT_INTERRUPTED_TRY_SAVE;
4000 cmd_files_test::s_goodbye();
4001 }
4002}

4046// copy a big number from a string, up to slash
4047static int get_bf(BigFloat bf, const char *cur_arg)
4048{
4049 if (const char *s = std::strchr(cur_arg, '/'); s)
4050 {
4051 const std::string buff(cur_arg, s);
4052 str_to_bf(bf, buff.c_str());
4053 }
4054 else
4055 {
4056 str_to_bf(bf, cur_arg);
4057 }
4058 return 0;
4059}
4060
4061// Get length of current args
4062static int get_cur_arg_len(const char *cur_arg)
4063{
4064 if (const char *s = std::strchr(cur_arg, '/'); s)
4065 {
4066 return static_cast<int>(s - cur_arg);
4067 }
4068
4069 return static_cast<int>(std::strlen(cur_arg));
4070}
4071
4072// Get max length of current args
4073static int get_max_cur_arg_len(const char *const float_val_str[], const int num_args)
4074{
4075 int max_str = 0;
4076 for (int i = 0; i < num_args; i++)
4077 {
4078 int tmp = get_cur_arg_len(float_val_str[i]);
4079 max_str = std::max(tmp, max_str);
4080 }
4081 return max_str;
4082}
4083
4084static std::string to_string(CmdFile value)
4085{
4086 static constexpr const char *const mode_str[4] = {"command line", "sstools.ini", "PAR file", "PAR file"};
4087 return mode_str[static_cast<int>(value)];
4088}
4089
4090// mode = 0 command line @filename
4091// 1 sstools.ini
4092// 2 <@> command after startup
4093// 3 command line @filename/setname
4094// this is like stopmsg() but can be used in cmdfiles()
4095// call with NULL for badfilename to get pause for driver_get_key()
4096int init_msg(const char *cmd_str, const char *bad_filename, const CmdFile mode)
4097{
4098 static int row = 1;
4099
4100 if (g_init_batch == BatchMode::NORMAL)
4101 {
4102 // in batch mode
4103 if (bad_filename)
4104 {
4105 return -1;
4106 }
4107 }
4108 char cmd[80];
4109 std::strncpy(cmd, cmd_str, 30);
4110 cmd[29] = 0;
4111
4112 if (*cmd)
4113 {
4114 std::strcat(cmd, "=");
4115 }
4116 std::string msg;
4117 if (bad_filename)
4118 {
4119 msg = std::string {"Can't find "} + cmd + bad_filename + ", please check " + to_string(mode);
4120 }
4121 if (g_first_init)
4122 {
4123 // & cmdfiles hasn't finished 1st try
4124 if (row == 1 && bad_filename)
4125 {
4126 driver_set_for_text();
4127 driver_put_string(0, 0, 15, "Id found the following problems when parsing commands: ");
4128 }
4129 if (bad_filename)
4130 {
4131 driver_put_string(row++, 0, 7, msg);
4132 }
4133 else if (row > 1)
4134 {
4135 driver_put_string(++row, 0, 15, "Press Escape to abort, any other key to continue");
4136 driver_move_cursor(row+1, 0);
4137 do_pause(2); // defer getakeynohelp until after parsing
4138 }
4139 }
4140 else if (bad_filename)
4141 {
4142 stop_msg(msg);
4143 }
4144 return 0;
4145}
4146
4147// Crude function to detect a floating point number. Intended for
4148// use with arbitrary precision.
4149static bool is_a_big_float(const char *str)
4150{
4151 // [+|-]numbers][.]numbers[+|-][e|g]numbers
4152 bool result = true;
4153 const char *s = str;
4154 int num_dot{};
4155 int num_e{};
4156 int num_sign{};
4157 while (*s != 0 && *s != '/' && *s != ' ')
4158 {
4159 if (*s == '-' || *s == '+')
4160 {
4161 num_sign++;
4162 }
4163 else if (*s == '.')
4164 {
4165 num_dot++;
4166 }
4167 else if (*s == 'e' || *s == 'E' || *s == 'g' || *s == 'G')
4168 {
4169 num_e++;
4170 }
4171 else if (!std::isdigit(*s))
4172 {
4173 result = false;
4174 break;
4175 }
4176 s++;
4177 }
4178 if (num_dot > 1 || num_sign > 2 || num_e > 1)
4179 {
4180 result = false;
4181 }
4182 return result;
4183}
4184
